column4: I am using gRip to rip my CDs to MP3. Everytime I insert a CD into the cd drive Sound Juicer comes up. Is there a setting that I can change that will make gRip com up?
System-Preferences-Removable Drives
sounds like a but
sounds like a bug
'metacity -replace' to turn it off. 'compiz -replace' to turn it on
what chipset?
the SIS driver has no 3D acceleration. Go without 3D effects -- they aren't that important
lspci | grep VGA
'sudo apt-get autoremove' cleans out orphaned packages. Consider also 'apt-get autoclean'
man apt-get makes for good reading
Depends: libgtk2.0-0
try 'killall firefox', or find out the process id with 'ps aux | grep firefox'
it wouldn't slow it down unless you are short of RAM
that's plenty, unless you open a lot of gnome apps
digikam will be a bit slower to open under gnome than under KDE, because it will access some shared libraries that will already be cached under KDE.
I just hate f-spot and I see that gqview is to limited for me but I do like it
I set it up in 4GB on my eeepc and it's creaking at the seams
I did add a lot of extra software, though
okay -- but openoffice takes more space than any other program or suite of programs
of those that are standard, I mean
I know, I wouldn't give it up. Just saying that most of the things you might add after your basic Ubuntu installation won't be nearly as big as OOo
